content.question: Which of the following is NOT a minor-seventh interval?

choices.label: Score A has one staff with no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a single chord of two whole notes. Score A is in the bass clef. The pitches are: a chord of A2 with G3.

Score B has one staff with no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a single chord of two whole notes. Score B is in the treble clef. The pitches are: a chord of F sharp 4 with E sharp 4.

Score C has one staff with no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a single chord of two whole notes. Score C is in the tenor clef. The pitches are: a chord of G sharp 3 with F sharp 4.

Score D has one staff with no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a single chord of two whole notes. Score D is in the alto clef. The pitches are: a chord of C3 with B flat 3.

content.answer: Score B has one staff with no key signature or time signature and only a single measure. The rhythm in the score is a single chord of two whole notes. Score B is in the treble clef. The pitches are: a chord of F sharp 4 with E sharp 4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
